intro: Hybanthus rivalis, commonly known as the red-eyed violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers with a distinctive red eye-like spot. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the stem tips. Hybanthus rivalis thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
